S:
## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 4x4 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (3, 3).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 1).
The grid has obstacles located at [(0, 1), (0, 2)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 5 OR c > 5.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (3, 3) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "From (1, 1), moving 'up' would result in (0, 1), which is an obstacle. Moving 'left' would result in (1, 0), which is within boundaries but not closer to the goal. Moving 'right' results in (1, 2), which is closer to the goal and within boundaries. Moving 'down' results in (2, 1), which is also closer to the goal and within boundaries. Both 'right' and 'down' are safe moves, but 'down' keeps us further from obstacles at (0, 1) and (0, 2).", "move": "down"}

## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 4x4 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (3, 3).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 1).
The grid has obstacles located at [(0, 1), (0, 2)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 5 OR c > 5.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (3, 3) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "From (2, 1), moving 'up' will take us to (1, 1), which is safe but increases the distance to the goal. Moving 'down' will take us to (3, 1), which is safe and closer to the goal. Moving 'left' will take us to (2, 0), which is safe but doesn't significantly reduce the distance to the goal. Moving 'right' will take us to (2, 2), which is safe and brings us closer to the goal.", "move": "right"}

You are a navigational agent in a 2D 4x4 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (3, 3).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 1).
The grid has obstacles located at [(0, 1), (0, 2)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 5 OR c > 5.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (3, 3) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "From (2, 2), moving 'up' to (1, 2) decreases distance to the goal, but moving 'right' to (2, 3) also brings us closer to the goal. Both moves are safe. Moving 'down' to (3, 2) brings us even closer to (3, 3) without hitting any obstacles or boundaries.", "move": "down"}

S:
## Task ##
You are a navigational agent in a 2D 4x4 grid world filled with specific obstacles and limited by boundaries.
Your objective is to navigate to (3, 3).

## Environment ##
Each cell in the grid is defined through coordinates (r,c).
Your starting position is at (1, 1).
The grid has obstacles located at [(0, 1), (0, 2)].
Collision with boundaries happens when:
r < -1 OR c < -1 OR r > 5 OR c > 5.
If you collide with obstacles the game ends immediately.

## Move commands ##
You can move in four directions:
"up" decreases r by one
"down" increases r by one
"left" decreases c by one
"right" increases c by one

## Objective ##
Given current position (r, c), navigate to (3, 3) using move commands.
Avoid collisions with obstacles and boundaries of the grid.

## Output Format ##
Generate JSON response to the prompt in following format:
{
    "explanation": "",
    "move": "up/down/left/right"
}
A: {"explanation": "From (3, 2), moving 'up' will take us to (2, 2), which is within the grid and not an obstacle, but it increases the distance to the goal. Moving 'down' will take us to (4, 2), which is within the grid and not an obstacle, but it increases the distance to the goal. Moving 'left' will take us to (3, 1), which is within the grid and not an obstacle, but it increases the distance to the goal. Moving 'right' will take us to (3, 3), which is our goal position.", "move": "right"}
